title: That Report IPGSCP24-011 - Agreement, Report CSSS24-006 – Community Housing Strategic Plan, Report LSCLK24-006 - Citizen Appointments to Various Committees, Report IPGENG24-013 - Maria Street Pedestrian Crossover and Report CSSS24-009 - Affordable Housing CIP - 21 Leahy's Lane Phase 2 Municipal Incentives Update be approved on Consent.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPGENG24-012, dated May 13, 2024, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure, Planning and Growth Management (Acting) as follows: That the Calendar Parking restriction be removed on Humber Road, between the south side of Saugeen Crescent and 536 Humber Road.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPGENG24-012, dated May 13, 2024, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure, Planning and Growth Management (Acting) as follows: That the Calendar Parking restriction be removed on Humber Road, between the south side of Saugeen Crescent and 536 Humber Road. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CSSS24-012, dated May 13, 2024 of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: a) That the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care Growth Plan 2023-2026 as attached as Appendix A be approved; and b) That the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care Growth Plan 2023-2026 be attached as Appendix D of the Peterborough Early Years and Child Care Service Plan 2019 – 2024 (linked as Appendix B to this report).

Therefore, be it resolved that the City of Peterborough formally requests the Province of Ontario to extend the deadline to process the listed properties under the Ontario Heritage Act from January 1, 2025, to January 1, 2030; Be it further resolved that this extension will allow the City of Peterborough, along with other municipalities, to more effectively engage with community stakeholders and property owners, ensuring that significant heritage properties are properly recognized and preserved; Be it finally resolved that a copy of this motion be sent to Premier Ford, the Minister of Citizenship and Multiculturalism, and relevant provincial officials to underscore the urgency and necessity of this request for the protection of Ontario’s heritage.
That By-law 24-032 Being a By-law to amend By-law 09-136 Being a By-law for the regulation of Parking on Maria Street in the City of Peterborough, be approved.
That By-law 24-034, Being a By-law to confirm the proceedings of the Council at its meeting held on May 21, 2024, be approved.
That this meeting be adjourned at 6:14 p.m.
